intro: Escobariopsis jaliscana, commonly known as the Jalisco cushion lichen, is a species of lichen that belongs to the family Caliciaceae. It is a small, foliose lichen characterized by its delicate, crust-like growth form and pale green to yellowish coloration. This lichen is typically found on bark and soil in humid, shaded environments, particularly in the Mexican state of Jalisco. It plays a role in soil stabilization and nutrient cycling in its ecosystem. Escobariopsis jaliscana is of interest to mycologists and botanists due to its limited distribution and ecological significance.
